text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Advisory Board" means the Criminal Justice Information Advisory Board.
"Central Repository" means the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository established under § 10-213 of this subtitle.

section.section: "Criminal history record information" means data that are developed or collected by a criminal justice unit about a person and that pertain to a reportable event.

"Criminal history record information" includes:
data from a unit that is required to report to the Central Repository under Title 3 of this article;
data about a person following waiver of jurisdiction by a juvenile court; and
data described under §§ 10-215(a)(20) and (21) and 10-216 of this subtitle.

"Criminal justice information system" means equipment, facilities, procedures, agreements, and personnel that are used to collect, process, preserve, and disseminate criminal history record information.
"Criminal justice information system" includes computer hardware and software.

Except as provided in §§ 10-215(a)(20) and (21), 10-216(d), and 10-220 of this subtitle, "criminal justice unit" does not include:
the Department of Juvenile Services; or
a juvenile court.
"Disseminate", with respect to records, means to transmit criminal history record information in any form.

"Disseminate" does not include:
transmitting criminal history record information within a criminal justice unit;
reporting criminal history record information as required under § 10-214 of this subtitle; or
transmitting criminal history record information between criminal justice units to allow the initiation of subsequent criminal justice proceedings against a person relating to the same crime.

text.section: "Reportable event" means an event specified or provided for in § 10-215 of this subtitle.
